parameters.name: KnotPoints
parameters.description: in-process, unmanaged C++: Pointer to an array of double values between 0 and 1, inclusive VBA, VB.NET, C#, and C++/CLI: Not supported See In-process Methods for details about this type of method.

title: ISplineParamData.IGetKnotPoints
description: Gets all of the knot points of the spline.
signature:
System.Boolean IGetKnotPoints( 
   System.Int32
Count
,
   out System.Double
KnotPoints
)

parameters.name: KnotPoints
parameters.description: in-process, unmanaged C++: Pointer to an array of double values between 0 and 1, inclusive VBA, VB.NET, C#, and C++/CLI: Not supported See In-process Methods for details about this type of method.

returns: True if successful, false if not
remarks:
Before calling this method, call
ISplineParamData::KnotPointsCount
to populate the Count parameter.
Together with
control points
, knots determine the shape and smoothness of a spline. The knot vector divides the parametric space into intervals or knot spans. These intervals may be uniform or non-uniform. Each interval governs a different control point.
